no.motif

Class Strings

  • java.lang.Object
    • no.motif.Strings

  • public final class Strings
extends Object
    Functions operating on strings.

    • Field Detail

      • toInt

        public static final Fn<String,Integer> toInt
        Converts a string to a int value using Integer.valueOf(String). If the string is null, 0 is yielded.

      • toLong

        public static final Fn<String,Long> toLong
        Converts a string to a long value using Long.valueOf(String). If the string is null, 0 is yielded.

      • toDouble

        public static final Fn<String,Double> toDouble
        Converts a string to a double value using Double.valueOf(String). If the string is null, 0 is yielded.

      • toChars

        public static final Fn<String,Iterable<Character>> toChars
        Splits a string into characters.

      • bytes

        public static final Fn<String,byte[]> bytes
        Yields the bytes of a String.
        See Also:
        String.getBytes()

      • blank

        public static final Predicate<String> blank
        A blank string is either null, empty, or all characters are whitespace.

      • nonblank

        public static final Predicate<String> nonblank
        A nonblank string has at least one character, and must contain at least one character which is not whitespace.

      • numeric

        public static final Predicate<String> numeric
        A numeric string must have at least one character, and all of them must be digits.

      • alphanumeric

        public static final Predicate<String> alphanumeric
        Alphanumeric strings are at least one character, and all digits and/or letters.

      • alphabetic

        public static final Predicate<String> alphabetic
        Alphabetic strings are at least one character, and all letters.

      • trimmed

        public static final Fn<String,String> trimmed
        Trims a string, removing all leading and trailing whitespace.

      • lowerCased

        public static final Fn<String,String> lowerCased
        Convert a string to lower case.

      • upperCased

        public static final Fn<String,String> upperCased
        Convert a string to upper case

      • length

        public static final Fn<String,Integer> length
        Gives the length of a string, i.e. the amount of characters. null yields length 0.

      • concat

        public static final Fn2<Object,Object,String> concat
        Concatenate a string with the string representation of an arbitrary object, i.e. reduces two strings to one.

      • reversed

        public static final Fn<String,String> reversed
        Yields the given string with its characters in reversed order.

      • allChars

        public static final Predicate<String> allChars(Predicate<Character> valid)
        Predicate verifying that all characters in a string satifies a given predicate.
        Parameters:
        valid - The predicate evaluating all characters in a string.

      • nonblankAllChars

        public static final Predicate<String> nonblankAllChars(Predicate<Character> valid)
        Predicate verifying that strings are not blank and each char satisfies a given predicate.
        Parameters:
        valid -

      • hasLength

        public static final Predicate<String> hasLength(int exactLength)
        Evaluate if strings are of a exact length. nulls are considered to have length zero.

      • hasLength

        public static final Predicate<String> hasLength(Predicate<? super Integer> accepted)
        Evaluate if strings have accepted lengths. nulls are considered to have length zero.
        Parameters:
        accepted - The predicate evaluating accepted length.
        Returns:
        The predicate evaluating string length.

      • contains

        public static Predicate<String> contains(CharSequence charSequence)
        Determines if a substring is present in a string. A string never contains null, nor does null contain any substring.
        Parameters:
        charSequence - The substring to find.
        Returns:
        The predicate.

        public static Predicate<String> startsWith(String prefix)
        Determines if a string starts with a given prefix string.
        Parameters:
        prefix - The prefix.
        Returns:
        The predicate.

        public static Predicate<String> endsWith(String suffix)
        Determines if a string ends with a given suffix string.
        Parameters:
        suffix - The suffix.
        Returns:
        The predicate.

        public static Predicate<String> matches(String regex)
        Does a regular expression match on strings.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the predicate.

        public static Fn<Object,String> prepend(String prefix)
        Create a new strings by prepending a prefix.
        Parameters:

        public static Fn<Object,String> append(String suffix)
        Create a new strings by appending a suffix.
        Parameters:
        suffix - the suffix to append

      • substring

        public static Fn<String,String> substring(int beginIndex,
                          int endIndex)
        Extract substring from strings. As this function simply delegates to String.substring(int, int), it may throw an IndexOutOfBoundsException if the given indexes are invalid.
        Parameters:
        beginIndex - The index of the first character to include.
        endIndex - The index to end the extraction.

      • substring

        public static Fn<String,String> substring(Fn<? super String,Integer> beginIndex,
                          Fn<? super String,Integer> endIndex)

      • first

        public static Fn<String,String> first(int charAmount)
        Get at most a given amount of the first characters of strings. If the string is shorter than the amount, the original string is returned.

      • last

        public static Fn<String,String> last(int charAmount)
        Get at most a given amount of the last characters of strings. If the string is shorter than the amount, the original string is returned.

      • inBetween

        public static Fn<Object,String> inBetween(String prefix,
                          String suffix)
        Insert strings in between a prefix and a suffix.
        Parameters:
        prefix - The prefix to appear before the string.
        suffix - The suffix to appear after the string

      • repeat

        public static Fn<String,String> repeat(int times)
        Repeats a string a given amount of times.
        Parameters:
        times - The amount of times to repeat the string.

      • repeat

        public static Fn<String,String> repeat(int times,
                       String separator)
        Repeats a string, insterting given separator, a given amount of times.
        Parameters:
        times - The amount of times to repeat the string.
        separator - The separator string to insert between the repeating strings.

      • after

        public static Fn<String,String> after(String substring)
        Inside strings, searches for the first occurence of a substring, and yields the rest of the string after the substring occurence, not including the substring itself.

        Passing null to the Fn always yields null

        If the substring is not found (or it is null), then null is returned.

        If the substring is the empty string, the original string is returned.

        Parameters:
        substring - the substring to search for.

      • afterLast

        public static Fn<String,String> afterLast(String substring)
        Inside strings, searches for the last occurence of a substring, and yields the rest of the string after the substring occurence, not including the substring itself.

        Passing null to the Fn always yields null

        If the substring is not found, or if it is null, then null is returned. If the substring is empty, the empty string is returned.

        Parameters:
        substring - the substring to search for.

      • from

        public static Fn<String,String> from(int index)
        Yields substrings from a position index.
        See Also:
        from(Fn)

      • from

        public static Fn<String,String> from(Fn<? super String,Integer> index)
        Yields substrings from a position index. If the given index Fn yields null, then null is returned. If a positive index out of bounds with the length of the string is yielded, the empty string is returned.

        A negative index value is invalid and will throw an StringIndexOutOfBoundsException.

        Passing the null-String always yields null.

        Parameters:
        index - The Fn to resolve the index.

      • before

        public static Fn<String,String> before(String substring)
        Inside strings, searches for the first occurence of a substring, and yields the the string before the substring occurence, not including the substring itself.

        Passing null to the Fn always yields null

        If the substring is null, the original string is returned. If the substring is not found, null is returned.

        If the substring is the empty string, or found from the beginning of the string, the empty string is returned.

        Parameters:
        substring - the substring to search for.

      • beforeLast

        public static Fn<String,String> beforeLast(String substring)
        Inside strings, searches for the last occurence of a substring, and yields the the string before the substring occurence, not including the substring itself.

        Passing null to the Fn always yields null

        If the substring is null or empty, the original string is returned. If the substring is not found, null is returned.

        Parameters:
        substring - the substring to search for.

      • before

        public static Fn<String,String> before(int index)
        Yields substrings before a position index.
        See Also:
        before(Fn)

      • before

        public static Fn<String,String> before(Fn<? super String,Integer> index)
        Yields substrings before a position index. If the given index Fn yields null, or a positive index out of bounds with the length of the string, the original string is returned.

        A negative index is invalid and will throw an StringIndexOutOfBoundsException.

        Passing the null-String always yields null.

        Parameters:
        index - The Fn to resolve the index.

      • between

        public static Fn<String,String> between(String openSubstring,
                        String closeSubstring)
        Yield the string _between_ two substrings. The substrings will be the first possible matches, which means between("x", "y") applied to the string "xxyy" will yield "x".
        Parameters:
        openSubstring -
        closeSubstring -

      • betweenOuter

        public static Fn<String,String> betweenOuter(String openSubstring,
                             String closeSubstring)
        Yield the string _between_ two outermost substrings. This means betweenOuter("x", "y") applied to the string "xxyy" will yield "xy".
        Parameters:
        openSubstring -
        closeSubstring -

      • allBetween

        public static Fn<String,Iterable<String>> allBetween(String openSubstring,
                                     String closeSubstring)
        Yield all strings occurring _between_ two substrings.
        Parameters:
        openSubstring -
        closeSubstring -

      • indexOf

        public static Fn<String,Integer> indexOf(char c)
        Yields index position of first occurence of a char, or null if the char cannot be found.
        See Also:
        String.indexOf(int)

      • lastIndexOf

        public static Fn<String,Integer> lastIndexOf(char c)
        Yields index position of last occurence of a char, or null if the char cannot be found.
        See Also:
        String.indexOf(int)

      • indexOf

        public static Fn<String,Integer> indexOf(String substring)
        Yields index position of first occurence of a substring, or null if the substring cannot be found.
        See Also:
        String.indexOf(String)

      • lastIndexOf

        public static Fn<String,Integer> lastIndexOf(String substring)
        Yields index position of last occurence of a substring, or null if the substring cannot be found.
        See Also:
        String.indexOf(String)
